snippet: Alan Gilbert’s programming for the New York Philharmonic’s coming season looks good at first glance but is somewhat disappointing.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reflects that music director Alan Gilbert’s programming for the New York Philharmonic’s 2012-2013 season looks good at first glance but is somewhat disappointing; says that too many programs plug new works or novelties into unremarkable groupings of standard repertory.
lead_paragraph: Alan Gilbert’s programming for the New York Philharmonic’s coming season looks good at first glance but is somewhat disappointing.

headline.seo: Alan Gilbert and New York Philharmonic’s 2012-13 Season
headline.main: Playing It Safe in Programming Philharmonic
headline.print_headline: Playing It Safe In Programming Philharmonic
